pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:5.1: 72. The training rule on walking off the path
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking off the path while giving teachings to people walking on the path. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:7.2: “‘I will not give teachings while walking off the path to anyone walking on the path who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:8.1: One should not give teachings while walking off the path to anyone walking on the path who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect gives teachings while walking off the path to someone walking on the path who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk72:10.1: The twelfth training rule is finished.
